a.g: By those [winds] sent forth in gusts
And the winds that blow violently
And [by] the winds that spread [clouds]
And those [angels] who bring criterion
And those [angels] who deliver a message
As justification or warning,
Indeed, what you are promised is to occur.
So when the stars are obliterated
And when the heaven is opened
And when the mountains are blown away
And when the messengers' time has come...
For what Day was it postponed?
For the Day of Judgement.
And what can make you know what is the Day of Judgement?
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
Did We not destroy the former peoples?
Then We will follow them with the later ones.
Thus do We deal with the criminals.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
Did We not create you from a liquid disdained?
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى ألم نخلقكم من ماء مهين فجعلناه في قرار مكين إلى قدر معلوم فتكرير ذكر النطفة في الكتاب العزيز ليس ليسمع لفظه ويترك التفكر في معناه فانظر الآن إلى النطفة وهي قطرة من الماء قذرة لو تركت ساعة ليضربها الهواء فسدت وانتنت كيف أخرجها رب الأرباب من الصلب والترائب وكيف جمع بين الذكر والأنثى وألقى الألفة والمحبة في قلوبهم وكيف قادهم بسلسلة المحبة والشهوة الى الاجتماع وكيف استخرج النطفة من الرجل بحركة الوقاع وكيف استجلب دم الحيض من أعماق العروق وجمعه في الرحم ثم كيف خلق المولود من النطفة وسقاه بماء الحيض وغذاه حتى نما وربا وكبر وكيف جعل النطفة وهي بيضاء مشرقة علقة حمراء ثم كيف جعلها مضغة ثم كيف قسم أجزاء النطفة وهي متساوية متشابهة إلى العظام والأعصاب والعروق والأوتار واللحم ثم كيف ركب من اللحوم والأعصاب والعروق الأعضاء الظاهرة فدور الرأس وشق السمع والبصر والأنف والفم وسائر المنافذ ثم مد اليد والرجل وقسم رءوسها بالأصابع وقسم الأصابع بالأنامل ثم كيف ركب الأعضاء الباطنة من القلب والمعدة والكبد والطحال والرئة والرحم والمثانة والأمعاء كل واحد على شكل مخصوص ومقدار مخصوص لعمل مخصوص ثم كيف قسم كل عضو من هذه الأعضاء بأقسام أخر فركب العين من سبع طبقات لكل طبقة وصف مخصوص وهيئة مخصوصة لو فقدت طبقة منها أو زالت صفة من صفاتها تعطلت العين عن الإبصار فانظر الآن إلى العظام وهي أجسام صلبة قوية كيف خلقها من نطفة سخيفة رقيقة ثم جعلها قواما للبدن وعمادا له ثم قدرها بمقادير مختلفة وأشكال مختلفة فمنه صغير وكبير وطويل ومستدير ومجوف ومصمت وعريض ودقيق
Indeed, did We not create you from a contemptible fluid [mā'in mahīn]? Then We placed it in a firm resting place [qarārin makīn], until a known term [qadar ma'lūm]. The repeated mention of the sperm-drop [nutfah] in the Mighty Book is not merely to hear its word and abandon reflection upon its meaning. So look now at the sperm-drop: it is a droplet of water, foul; if left for an hour for the air to strike it, it would spoil and become putrid. How did the Lord of Lords bring it forth from the loins and the ribs? And how did He bring together the male and the female, and cast affection [ulfah] and love [mahabbah] into their hearts [qulūb]? And how did He lead them by the chain of love and desire to union? And how did He extract the sperm-drop from the man through the movement of intercourse? And how did He draw the menstrual blood from the depths of the veins and gather it in the womb? Then, how did He create the infant from the sperm-drop, and nourish it with the water of menstruation, and feed it until it grew, increased, and became large? And how did He make the sperm-drop, which is white and shining, into a clinging clot ['alaqah] that is red? Then how did He make it a chewed lump [mudghah]? Then how did He divide the parts of the sperm-drop, which are equal and similar, into bones, nerves, veins, tendons, and flesh? Then how did He construct from the flesh, nerves, and veins the outward limbs: the roundness of the head, the aperture of hearing, sight, the nose, the mouth, and the rest of the openings? Then He extended the hand and the foot, and divided their ends into fingers, and divided the fingers into fingertips? Then how did He construct the inward organs: the heart [qalb], the stomach, the liver, the spleen, the lung, the womb, the bladder, and the intestines—each one with a specific form, a specific measure, for a specific function? Then how did He divide each of these organs into other divisions? He constructed the eye from seven layers; for each layer a specific attribute and a specific configuration—if a single layer from them were lost, or an attribute from its attributes were removed, the eye would be incapacitated from sight. So look now at the bones: they are solid, strong bodies. How did He create them from a weak, delicate sperm-drop? Then He made them the framework [qiwām] for the body and its support. Then He proportioned them with different measures and different forms: among them small and large, long and round, hollow and solid, broad and slender.

a.g: And We placed it in a firm lodging
For a known extent.
And We determined [it], and excellent [are We] to determine.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
Have We not made the earth a container
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فظهرها مقر للأحياء وبطنها مرقد للأموات قال تعالى ألم نجعل الأرض كفاتا أحياء وأمواتا
Indeed, its surface [zahiruha] is a dwelling place [maqarr] for the living [al-ahya'], and its interior [batnuha] is a resting place [marqad] for the dead [al-amwat]. The Most High has said: "Have We not made the earth a receptacle [kifatan], for the living and the dead?"

a.g: Of the living and the dead?
And We placed therein lofty, firmly set mountains and have given you to drink sweet water.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
[They will be told], "Proceed to that which you used to deny.
Proceed to a shadow [of smoke] having three columns
[But having] no cool shade and availing not against the flame."
Indeed, it throws sparks [as huge] as a fortress,
As if they were yellowish [black] camels.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
This is a Day they will not speak,
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقد تقدم وأما ما نقل من الوجد بالقرآن عن الصحابة رضي الله عنهم والتابعين فكثير فمنهم من صعق ومنهم من بكى ومنهم من غشي عليه ومنهم من مات في غشيته وسمع الشافعي رحمه الله قارئا يقرأ هذا يوم لا ينطقون ولا يؤذن لهم فيعتذرون فغشى عليه
Indeed, what has been transmitted concerning the spiritual ecstasy [wajd] experienced through the Qur'an from the Companions, may God be pleased with them, and the Followers is abundant. Among them were those who were thunderstruck [sa'iq], and among them were those who wept, and among them were those who fell unconscious [ghashiya 'alayhi], and among them were those who died in their state of unconsciousness. And Al-Shafi'i, may God have mercy on him, heard a reciter reciting: "This is a Day on which they will not speak, nor will they be permitted to offer excuses." (77:35-36), and he fell unconscious.

a.g: Nor will it be permitted for them to make an excuse.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
This is the Day of Judgement; We will have assembled you and the former peoples.
So if you have a plan, then plan against Me.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
Indeed, the righteous will be among shades and springs
And fruits from whatever they desire,
[Being told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."
Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
[O disbelievers], eat and enjoy yourselves a little; indeed, you are criminals.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
And when it is said to them, "Bow [in prayer]," they do not bow.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
Then in what statement after the Qur'an will they believe?
